sub_title: Experienced aerospace engineer and enthusiastic pilot with curiosity and passion for learning and exploring
summary:
Experienced aerospace engineer and enthusiastic pilot with curiosity and passion for learning and exploring. Recognized expert in composite material structural concept design, analysis, testing and manufacturing. Dynamic, extravert and open personality with empathy, social and communication skills. Polyglot mastering 4 languages fluently and enthusiastic about learning new languages and cultures. Team player with excitement for problem solving and strong goal-oriented mentality. Pronounced creative way of researching and working. Eager to realize new ventures. Multidisciplinary with international experience in turnkey solutions, ranging from coaching, development, engineering and manufacturing. 

Participated in various programmes over a broad range of industry disciplines and fields: academic lecturing, aeronautical, space, automotive, energy, oil & gas, naval, semiconductor.

treasury_media.description: Graphene nanotubes grant engineers the ability to produce totally new, highly innovative and competitive products. At the 2019 Nanoaugmented Materials Industry Summit (NAUM’19), experts concurred that graphene nanotubes, also known as single wall...

awards.title: 3rd ESA Workshop on Advanced Manufacturing at ESTEC, Invitation to participate on the topic of future advanced manufacturing technologies
awards.description:
https://www.esa.int/Enabling_Support/Space_Engineering_Technology/Advanced_Manufacturing

Through the new Advanced Manufacturing initiative ESA aims to home in on emerging manufacturing technologies which open up new industrial possibilities in terms of design freedom, streamlined production stages and reduced cost, along with enhanced performance from the final product.

awards.title: Innovation Roundtable at Bosch, Stuttgart, invitation to participate on the topics of “IoT, AI, and Digital Service Models” as well as “Working Lean & Agile and Attracting Digital Talent”

awards.title: Airbus Dream Big Summit Invitation
awards.description: Winning ticket for Airbus Dream Big Summit in Toulouse by pitching two of the most innovative and disruptive ideas within Airbus. Summit was facilitated by globally recognised experts in topics including exponential technologies, robotics, artificial intelligence, automation, crowdsourcing and the disruptive business models that are changing the face of modern business

authors.headline: Experienced aerospace engineer and enthusiastic pilot with curiosity and passion for learning and exploring

authors.name: J. M. Engel, D. Polling, R. Yaldiz et al.

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with operational support improvement and execution of spacecraft integration in ISO5 and ISO8 clean rooms at Airbus DS facility in Ottobrunn - Mechanical Assembly Test and Integration (MAIT) of Copernicus Sentinel-5 Programme: optical instrument integration.

General activities cover configuration control, research, development and implementation of efficient integration procedures and (support) hardware from supplier(s) to the end customer. Advancement and standardisation of high precision positioning processes is key to project success.
profile_positions.title: Senior Engineer - MAIT Space Systems, Spacecraft Production Germany

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with product innovation and operational improvement of legacy structures, specifically for solar array systems at Airbus DS facility in Ottobrunn. 

General activities cover configuration control, PMP set-up and support with approval of project documents. Special attention was given to developing and growing of the composite manufacturing supplier base, advancing it technologically and guiding a development of a quality and continuous improvement mind-set (on-site and off-site technical support). 

Further activities cover providing support for design, development, testing and industrialisation of the various satellite constellation programs (e.g. One Web, Telesat), as well as for ENEO, the Next Generation of Solar Arrays, with focus on structural component supplier base development (OQOTOC, CID action plan).

As founding member of the Culture Change Drivers initiative supporting new ways of working companywide roll-out.
profile_positions.title: Senior Engineer - Development, Manufacturing & Industrialisation Solar Array Systems

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with product development policy and roadmap for space craft systems and in particular solar arrays, including structural analysis and support to composite manufacturing suppliers.

General activities include configuration control, approval of project documents and composite manufacturing technology advancement, including training of personnel to understand the technologies at stake. Involved in a plethora of scientific and commercial missions.

In 2011 appointed as product owner of solar array substrates for all programs.
profile_positions.title: Senior Engineer - Product Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with presidency and organisation of the EYE2012 Netherlands conference “Engineering Connections” 

General activities include connecting with political and think-tank organisations, EU Commission and parliament, leading industrial organisations, CEO talks, fundraising and partnerships with educational and institutional entities. Furthermore, advancing the interest of (engineering) students across many European countries and bringing bright minds together.
 
NOTE: EYE is a dynamic and rapidly growing organisation with enthusiastic members, in 2012 consisting of 18 associations and representing more than 150.000 young engineers in Europe.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
IOM-Development Program of the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs

Tasked with informing and inspiring students by providing a vision for the possibilities and future developments in engineering

General activities cover networking and lecturing using cutting edge examples from industry at the University of Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, specifically the faculties of Electrical Engineering and Mechanical Engineering, and the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Secondment to Diehl Aircabin, Laupheim A350XWB Project, Germany

Tasked with tracking and monitoring of Diehl Aircabin's Risk Share Partners and Suppliers regarding their sub-contracted work packages (stress, SEI, life-cycle, validation and verification of documents). Specific structural analyses on composite material structures.

Planning and Project Management for relevant qualification modules.

Task list of all project related qualification activities.
profile_positions.title: Composite Stress Engineer Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with on-time and within budget design, development and manufacturing of metallic and composite components to the customer’s satisfaction for various projects in sectors of energy, automotive, transportation, aerospace, oil & gas. All projects involved a budget of up to hundred fifty thousand Euros and were executed according to ISO9001:2000 standard. 

General engineering expertise activities covered consulting in the field of propulsion hydro-elastic analysis, naval hull modification, aircraft empennage structure, semiconductor machining equipment, naval dredging, deep sea turbine detail analysis, high-pressure compressor conceptual design, noise reduction in public transport.

In addition I gave lectures in Composite Materials at Delft University of Technology, Faculty of Maritime Engineering, and supported training of the KLM Maintenance Department. In line with these activities I supervised students who graduated on subjects within Airborne’s Technology Centre. Support on the specific topic of structural analysis, design and manufacturing of composite materials and structuures.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with EIS interface loads for the A400M fixed trailing edge project.

General activities cover structural analysis of ribs using FEM and hand calculations. In addition F&DT analysis of ribs and joints using Airbus UK DAMTOL software and MathCAD.
profile_positions.title: Stress Engineer Consultant

profile_positions.description: Involved in the A380 wing fixed leading edge certification project as a Stress Engineer. In this function I was responsible for assuring that product requirements are met and that proper analysis methods are devised for certification.  I also provided support externally to customers (Airbus UK) on a project basis (Flight Test Instrumentation for instance) and internally with respect to the product definition during the manufacturing phase. I performed static and fatigue analysis on composite skin and riblets of A380 leading edge using Nastran and Patran programs. Also applied classical calculations to verify the results obtained from Nastran. Further justification by comparing the results with test components. Additionally performed MRB support tasks on Fokker special products, such as Gulfstream CFC elevator and Airbus A380 composite leading edge.
profile_positions.title: Stress Engineer

company.name: General Dynamics, Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, USA

profile_positions.description: Industrial placement at Gulfstream Aerospace. I was assigned to the composites division and given the task of establishing methods for detection of void content (porosity) with ultrasound in composite products. In close cooperation with stress engineering and product design direct on the production line I succeeded in determining the effects of the porosity on the mechanical strength of products and in establishment of allowable levels for quality inspection. In addition I performed analysis on built composite structures by incorporating the determined allowables developed from the test data and I drafted the financial analysis.
profile_positions.title: Intern
